What kind of instruments is it for?
Those sheets are standard Jazz sheets written in a C-Clef. If you know how to play Jazz, you should be able to play those songs on ANY instrument...for example on a trumpet ;)
Well, then I must rewrite it, because I play in bass clef :/.

You know - I'm going to comment on this when completed and let you all know what the deal is.

Hey Gammazoni, these are Bb books. Meaning that you can totally play your bass or whatever along with these. Just take it down a full step. So if the sheet says Bb, you are playing an Ab. F=Eb G=F C=Bb .... so on. This is called Transposing. You're just transposing into the key of C. It takes a little getting used to it but anyone that plays Jazz has to do this eventually.
